condition.description:
Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) is a real illness. You can get PTSD after living through or seeing a traumatic event, such as war, a hurricane, sexual assault, physical abuse, or a bad accident. PTSD makes you feel stressed and afraid after the danger is over. It affects your life and the people around you.

PTSD can cause problems like

  • Flashbacks, or feeling like the event is happening again
  • Trouble sleeping or nightmares
  • Feeling alone
  • Angry outbursts
  • Feeling worried, guilty, or sad

PTSD starts at different times for different people. Signs of PTSD may start soon after a frightening event and then continue. Other people develop new or more severe signs months or even years later. PTSD can happen to anyone, even children.

Treatment may include talk therapy, medicines, or both. Treatment might take 6 to 12 weeks. For some people, it takes longer.

NIH: National Institute of Mental Health

basics.bottom_line: Paxil is good for treating depression and anxiety but it causes more weight gain, sleepiness, and withdrawal symptoms than other antidepressants.
downsides: Can cause more sexual side effects like low libido and an inability to orgasm or ejaculate than most antidepressants.

Can harm an unborn child, so you can't take it if you're pregnant.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people younger than age 24.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Paxil may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Paxil is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Paxil may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Paxil is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Paxil with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Paxil suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Paxil suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Paxil can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Paxil can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

description_processed.orig: Paxil can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Paxil can harm a developing fetus. Don't use it while pregnant, especially in the first trimester. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Zoloft can cause a potentially life-threatening condition called serotonin syndrome when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Symptoms include agitation, sweating, muscle spasms, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, fast heart rate, fever, shaking, and hallucinations. Take the prescribed dose only, and avoid drug interactions with other medications that affect serotonin or that slow the metabolism of Zoloft.

description_processed.orig: Zoloft can cause a potentially life-threatening condition called serotonin syndrome when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Take the prescribed dose only, and avoid drug interactions with other medications that affect serotonin or that slow the metabolism of Zoloft.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

risks_warnings.title: Bone fractures
risks_warnings.description: Studies have shown that Zoloft increases the risk of bone fractures. It's not known why.

description_processed.orig: Studies have shown that Zoloft increases the risk of bone fractures. It's not known why.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Withdrawal symptoms may occur if you decrease the dose or stop Zoloft suddenly. Symptoms include nausea, dizziness, muscle aches, fatigue, chills, anxiety, and irritability. Gradually reduce your dose to avoid withdrawal.

description_processed.orig: Withdrawal symptoms may occur if you decrease the dose or stop Zoloft suddenly. Symptoms include nausea, dizziness, muscle aches, fatigue, chills, anxiety, and irritability. Gradually reduce your dose to avoid withdrawal.

risks_warnings.title: Abnormal bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Zoloft may increase risk of bleeding, bruising, or bleeding in the gut. Be careful taking it with blood-thinning drugs such as warfarin, aspirin, or nonsteroidal anti-inflammatories (like ibuprofen).

description_processed.orig: Zoloft may increase risk of bleeding, bruising, or bleeding in the gut. Be careful taking it with blood-thinning drugs such as warfarin, aspirin, or nonsteroidal anti-inflammatories (like ibuprofen).

risks_warnings.title: Low sodium levels in the blood
risks_warnings.description: Zoloft may increase the risk of low sodium levels in the blood (hyponatremia). Watch out for symptoms including headache, difficulty concentrating, memory problems, confusion, weakness, and unsteadiness, which may lead to falls. Talk to a doctor right away before developing more serious symptoms, such as hallucination, fainting, coma, and death.

carousel_items: Takes about 8 to 12 weeks to see the medication's full effects on your mood.
You can take the extended-release form once a day with food either in the morning or in the evening at about the same time each day.
Extended-release capsules should be swallowed whole. If you can’t swallow pills, open the capsule, sprinkle it on a spoonful of applesauce and then swallow it without chewing.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

basics.benefits_moa: Venlafaxine is a serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) antidepressant. It increases serotonin and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulate mood.
basics.bottom_line: Venlafaxine is good for treating depression and anxiety. May work when other antidepressants haven't, it's but more likely to cause side effects and withdrawal symptoms than other antidepressants.
downsides: Can cause sexual side effects like low libido and an inability to orgasm or ejaculate.
Not the best option for people with high blood pressure.
Overdosing on this medication could be fatal.
It's more likely to cause nausea and vomiting or make you feel sick if you miss a dose than other antidepressants. Also causes more sleepiness than others.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people younger than 24.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

upsides: Effective at relieving depression and anxiety symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Venlafaxine may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Venlafaxine is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Venlafaxine may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Venlafaxine is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Venlafaxine with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Venlafaxine suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Venlafaxine can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

description_processed.orig: Venlafaxine can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Venlafaxine can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Venlafaxine can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

basics.benefits_moa: Amitriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA). Researchers don't know exactly how it works. It may change serotonin and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulates mood and pain perception. It also has sedative effects.
basics.bottom_line: Amitriptyline is an older antidepressant that's sometimes used to treat pain and sleep problems, but it can have more side effects than similar medications.
downsides: When used for depression, Amitriptyline causes more side effects and has a higher risk of overdose than other antidepressants. It's usually used when other medications haven't worked.
It's more likely to cause sleepiness, nausea, constipation, diarrhea, and weight gain (1 to 5 pounds) than other antidepressants.
People age 65 and older have a higher risk for this medication's side effects.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people age 24 and younger.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Prozac with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms. Also, Prozac takes a long time to completely clear from your body. Make sure enough time is allowed to clear the medication completely before switching to another medication that affects serotonin, especially an MAO-I antidepressant.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Prozac suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

basics.bottom_line: Risperdal is good for treating psychosis, mania, and irritability. Among newer antipsychotic medicines, more likely to cause side effects, especially weight gain and hormone problems.
downsides: Mild to moderate risk of Extrapyramidal Symptoms (EPS): Movement disorders that include stiffness, tremor, restlessness, and slow, repetitive, or involuntary movements.
Moderate risk of weight gain and problems with cholesterol or blood sugar compared to other antipsychotics.
Compared to other antipsychotics, higher risk of hormone problems that cause nipples to leak and male breasts to grow abnormally large.
You might need routine blood tests to check how the medicine is affecting your body.
All antipsychotics come with side effects that make them difficult to take. You might need to try a few different medicines until you find one that works for you and that you can tolerate.

upsides: Effective at relieving psychotic symptoms, manic episodes, irritability, and aggressive behavior.
Lowers relapse rates in people with schizophrenia and people with irritability associated with autism.
Antipsychotic medicines are all about equally effective.
Less likely to cause heart problems than some antipsychotics.

drugs.one_liner: Helps control your thoughts and mood.

userStories.tip:
If you are on multiple medications be aware that the risk of serious side effects are higher. 
As soon as you experience any EPS take a dose of Benadryl & if that doesn't work go see your doctor asap or the hospital for a shot of Cogentin.
Serious weight gain

userStories.identifier: Mother of two sons and Synchro swimmer
userStories.tip: I take it only twice a week .5 at a time for prevention of break through symptoms. I experience only about 1-2# weight gain that I can work off the rest of the week. When I am in a serious state of mania, I take 1-3mg day. This ALWAYS works
Too many side effects for me, had to stop. Caused blurry vision, weight gain, and a slew of other crap.
Take smaller doses throughout the day to avoid negative side effects.

drugs.name: Risperdal

off-label_indications.indication: Behavioral symptoms associated with mental retardation

carousel_items_processed.orig: Takes 4 to 6 weeks to see full effects on thoughts and mood.
Can cause dizziness and drowsiness.
For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
May cause weight gain and worsen cholesterol or blood sugar.
Report any unusual thoughts, inability to control muscle movements, or fever and excess sweating to your doctor.
Elderly people with dementia shouldn't take it.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of death
risks_warnings.description: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Risperdal is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

description_processed.orig: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Risperdal is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Risperdal can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away. You may need routine blood tests while on this medication.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Risperdal can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away. You may need routine blood tests while on this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome
risks_warnings.description: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic (neuroleptic) medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, full body stiffness, and confusion. Seek medical attention immediately.

description_processed.orig: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic (neuroleptic) medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, full body stiffness, and confusion. Seek medical attention immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Risperdal can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. However, Risperdal causes fewer heart problems compared to some antipsychotic medications. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

description_processed.orig: Risperdal can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. However, Risperdal causes fewer heart problems compared to some antipsychotic medications. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Shaking and restlessness
risks_warnings.description: Risperdal can cause uncontrollable shaking, muscle stiffness, or feeling very restless. However, Risperdal is less likely to cause these symptoms compared to other antipsychotic medications. Tell your doctor if you experience any abnormal movements or restlessness.

description_processed.orig: Risperdal can cause uncontrollable shaking, muscle stiffness, or feeling very restless. However, Risperdal is less likely to cause these symptoms compared to other antipsychotic medications. Tell your doctor if you experience any abnormal movements or restlessness.

risks_warnings.title: Higher blood sugar and cholesterol
risks_warnings.description: Risperdal can increase your blood sugar and cholesterol. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

description_processed.orig: Risperdal can increase your blood sugar and cholesterol. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

risks_warnings.title: Weight gain
risks_warnings.description: Risperdal can cause you to gain weight. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

description_processed.orig: Risperdal can cause you to gain weight. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Risperdal impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Risperdal impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness and falls may occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms persist, a different medication may be better for you.
